engine

Class GraphToolkit

  • java.lang.Object
    • engine.GraphToolkit

  • public class GraphToolkit
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides access to all of the algorithms found in the Centrality, Flow, and Search classes. It is the external API for the Graph Toolkit.

      • bfs

        public static java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> bfs(Graph g,
                                    int srcID,
                                    int tgtID,
                                    boolean flow)
        Wrapper for BFS.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graph
        srcID - the node to start BFS from
        tgtID - the node to end BFS at
        flow - whether or not this is BFS on a flow graph
        Returns:
        the shortest path from src to tgt.
        See Also:
        Search.bfs(Graph, Node, Node, boolean)

        Wrapper for DFS that outputs a DFS Tree.
        Parameters:
        g - the Graph
        srcID - the start Node's ID
        Returns:
        A DFS tree mapping of nodes to start and finish times
        See Also:
        Search.dfsTree(Graph, Node)

      • getSingleSourceShortestPath

        public static java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.Double> getSingleSourceShortestPath(Graph g,
                                                                            int srcID)
        Wrapper for the Bellman-Ford algorithm.
        Parameters:
        g - the input graph
        srcID - the starting node's ID
        Returns:
        a map with shortest paths distances from src to every other node
        See Also:
        Search.bellmanFord(Graph, Node)

        Parameters:
        g - the input graph
        Returns:

        See Also:

      • getMaxFlow

        public static int getMaxFlow(Graph g,
             int srcID,
             int tgtID)
        Wrapper for the Ford-Fulkerson algorithm.
        Parameters:
        g - The graph to find
        srcID - the starting node's ID
        tgtID - the ending node's ID
        Returns:
        the maximum flow from src -> tgt on the graph g
        See Also:
        Flow.getMaxFlow(Graph, Node, Node)
